overview: The Nokomis Trail is structured around gentle story stations, layered listening moments, and a gathering space that modulates between shelter and openness.
storyStationsNote: Proposed 5–7 story stations with interpretive signage and QR codes linking to SON-approved audio narration. Examples below highlight the tone of those stations.

storyStations.title: Lakewatch Knoll
storyStations.description: Layers of limestone and misty morning light offer room to reflect on freshwater stewardship.

storyStations.title: Cedar Throat
storyStations.description: Ancient cedar walls cradle the sound of wind, creating an intimate setting for the trail keeper’s short reflections.

storyStations.title: Sandbar Rill
storyStations.description: A quiet sand spit that frames the shoreline’s slow migrations and invites mindful breathing.

gatheringSpace.title: Gathering Space (Amphitheatre)
gatheringSpace.description: An amphitheatre-like circle for shared storytelling, teaching moments, and calm pauses before continuing down the trail.

welcomeCentre.title: Welcome Circle
welcomeCentre.description: A low-profile pavilion opening toward the lake, where guests receive context for the day and learn how to move softly through each section of the trail.
welcomeCentre.details: Coordinated departure points ensure we arrive with minimal impact.
welcomeCentre.hours: Hours to be confirmed during launch.
